metadata.synopsis: A follow-up with Shadowheart after her Ultimatum dialogue, where the Box forces her to camp in a haze of murderous madness. Occurs if the player talked her down and got her to rest. She's calmer now, but still unsettled and confused - what is it that compelled her to act against her will like that? She and the player can discuss, but no clear answer emerges. The player can invite her to join their party.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: My head's been in a fog for days. This morning, it cleared away.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: I'm not much for bowing and scraping, but... thank you.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Indeed, our last talk was abrupt, let's say. Tell me about yourself.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: Beyond 'Shadowheart'? There's not much to say.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: I was on my way to Baldur's Gate when that ship appeared. Considering our... shared affliction, I think you know the rest.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: There's more to a person than a name. Surely there's more you can tell me.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: Perhaps you'll learn more in time then. If we have time, that is.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: We find a healer - fast. We can't have much time left before ceremorphosis takes hold.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Agreed. Do you have any ideas?

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: Baldur's Gate is an obvious answer, but we landed too damn far away.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: I doubt we'd make it in time. There has to be someone else nearby.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Come with me. Might as well carry out this hunt together.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: I would, but you have a lot of hangers-on already. Thin your numbers, then we can talk.

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: I won't refuse some company. So long as it's outside my head.

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: Even if that gith over there doesn't seem to like me.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: Let's set off. Time is against us.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: 'We'? You tried to kill me, remember? I didn't agree to a partnership.

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: Neither of us agreed to a lot of what's happened lately. Perhaps together, we can change that.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Or perhaps I was mistaken, keeping your around.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: I'll extend the grace you gave me and pretend that's not a threat.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: I can be valuable in more ways than you might expect. When you figure out you need me, just say the word.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You can stay here, in camp.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: A relative safe haven, I suppose. I'll be here if you need me.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: If you say so. Honestly, I feel fine. Better than ever, in ways.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: I... feel better too. Now that the voices are gone.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: But no doubt there's a tadpole squirming in our heads. We have to act.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: We need only find my kin. They will have a cure.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: They do? I... well. That's curious.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: My kin fought the ghaik menace for generations. We know their ways.

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: I didn't mean... fine. Yes. If you have a cure, then I need it as much as you do.
72.context: NodeContext: She'll go along with it for now.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You seem uncomfortable around my kind - why?

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: No offence, but my first experience with your kind was one of your dragons nearly roasting me alive.
0.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a gith player

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: And your fellow gith stares at me like she's contemplating how my heart tastes.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You should be grateful. Not many outsiders ever benefit from githyanki knowledge.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: I'll save my gratitude for when I'm cured.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Shadowheart? Interesting. Would've pegged you for a 'Molly', myself.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: A haunting pack of voices almost drove me to murder you, and my name is strange?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I'm glad to run into a fellow half-elf.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: We're not exactly special. There's a lot of bored elves and curious humans out there.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm just glad to see you're feeling better.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: You should be careful. Plenty would take advantage of that.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Tell me about these voices again. There must be more to them.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: They weren't distinct. Just... this constant onslaught.
85.context: NodeContext: It's difficult to articulate. Like describing a fading dream upon waking,.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: Run. Run. Find them. It only ever stopped when I went the right direction.
29.context: NodeContext: It's difficult to articulate. Like describing a fading dream upon waking,.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: And even then, only for a moment. Until I got here.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: The voices wanted you to find me? Personally?

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: Apparently so. They weren't inclined to explain why, just to drive half-berserk.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: And trust me, I'd love an explanation.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Not still harbouring urges to kill me, are you?

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: No. As long as the voices stay away, I think you're safe.

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: But I promise any future murderous intentions will be thoroughly justified.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: This is no laughing matter. I mightn't be so understanding in future.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: You have nothing to fear from me, so long as the feeling's mutual.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Sounds like you'll keep things interesting, at least.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Remarkably calm for someone I planned to run through.  I can appreciate that.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: If the voices return, tell me at once.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: I'll do what I can. It was difficult to do... anything in that haze.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: These voices could be to do with our infection.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: You have a tadpole too. I'm the only one who lost her bloody mind.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: I'm not ruling anything out. Unfortunately that doesn't leave me with a lot of firm answers.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: You spoke about voices in your head last night. Tell me more.

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: Staying in this camp is making me... restless.

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: But I don't want to stray far. I've already learned the consequences the hard way.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Travel with me. I think we can both be of use to each other.

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: You I don't mind, but your... kin is another story.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: I'm sure things will sort themselves out on the road.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Don't worry about her. I'm the one in charge.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: Fair enough. But a leader should always keep potential conflicts in mind, yes?

50.speaker: Player
50.text: We're all in this together. Whatever the issue with her is... best if you forget it.

63.speaker: Shadowheart
63.text: Strange bedfellows and such. All right.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: And what does your gith companion have to say about that?
